forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. Northwest wind 3 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
The morning unfolds in Downtown San Francisco with a heavy shroud of clouds and rain that casts a damp pall over the city. Whispers of precipitation linger in the air, the sky draped in a thick gray, making it impossible to find the sun’s warmth today. As the day moves forward, rain is predicted until the afternoon, easing into a partly sunny disposition but never straying far from the cool embrace of a brisk breeze. The temperature will gently descend, wrapping the city in layers of chill as the winds pick up, creating an energetic rustle in the trees that line the winding streets.

Given the conditions, dressing in layered, waterproof clothing will be wise. A solid pair of boots can navigate the slick sidewalks, while an umbrella can safeguard against unexpected bursts of rain. As the clouds begin to part later in the day, the allure of a cozy café beckons—perhaps nestled near the waterfront, where the views are bolstered by a backdrop of rolling fog that still clings to the hilltops. Comfort and warmth will be your companions, ideal for indulging in a good book or catching up with friends over fragrant cups of coffee, as the afternoon transforms into a picturesque, albeit chilly, conclusion to the day.
